task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 305°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full building (base to roofline) and any reference features, so I will tilt the camera up while keeping the same heading.
The view is now pointed north and up, but the target building was NW (~305°), so I should rotate left to re-center the building while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline.
I’m back on the correct NW heading but need the full vertical extent for height estimation, so I should look up again to include the roofline and upper facade.
The heading has drifted to due north again, so I need to rotate left back to ~305° to keep the building centered while pitched up.
To estimate height I need a view that includes the building’s top, so I will tilt up while staying on the NW heading.
The view is again centered at 0° instead of the target 305°, so I should rotate left to re-align to the NW building while keeping pitch up.
We keep returning to level pitch; to estimate height I must see the upper floors/roof, so I will look up once more.
To keep the building in view I must rotate from 0° back to the NW (~305°) direction while maintaining the upward pitch.
I’m still not getting a stable view of the building’s top and bottom together, so I will move slightly to the right to improve perspective and then estimate.
I need to face the target building direction (NW ~305°), which is now to my left, so I will rotate left to 306°.
I’m close but still 35° shy of the NW (~305°) target heading, so I will rotate slightly right to 305°.
I’m currently facing 35° but the building should be at 305° (left), so I will rotate left to 305° to center it.
From 270° I need to rotate about +35° to face the NW building (~305°).
The target building direction (305°) is directly to my left from 35°, so I should rotate left to 305° and then estimate height.
To face NW (~305°) from 270°W, I need a small right rotation of 35°.
I need to reorient from 35° to the building at 305°, so I will rotate left to 305°.
I should stop rotating back and forth and instead use the provided 'custom heading' to directly face 305° from 270° by rotating +35°.
The building is at heading 305° which is available directly as the 'look left' option, so rotate left to 305° to proceed with height estimation.
I will tilt the camera up to capture the roofline and upper facade so I can estimate the building height.
The pitch is up but heading has snapped to 0°, so I need to rotate left to bring the NW (~305°) building back into view.
Now that I’m correctly facing the building at 305°, I should keep this heading and look up to include the roofline for a height estimate.
Since the view jumps to 0° when looking up, I should directly rotate to a custom heading of 305° while keeping pitch 30° to see the building top.
I should stop trying to keep pitch up (it resets) and instead estimate height from this level view by counting visible floors and typical floor height.
